moves.1. d4: An interesting little game with a nice combination at the end.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5: So far, not much to say. Solid play on both sides. But this is questionable. The black king will remain in the center.
moves.14. Nxd7 Kxd7 15. f3: Probably the best way to clear the center and aim for the king.
moves.15... Nd6 16. e4 Nac4: An interesting attempt to save the day. Will it work? Of course, pxp does not stop the attack, because the black pawn at f5 is pinned.
moves.17... Qe6:
Is Qg5 better? After pxN, Ne3 does not work because of Qd2.
How about Qh6? Qe2 becomes the move for white much as in the game.
moves.18. exd6 Ne3 19. Qe2: Now either rook to e8 is the only move if black wants to continue.
moves.19... Nxf1 20. Bxf5: The crunch. Even the poor little pawn on d6 helps on the attack.
moves.20... Qxf5 21. Qe7+ Kc8 22. Qc7#: Strange how the attack developed quickly after black allowed their king to stay in the center traffic.
